dublinCore.dc:title: 113 HRES 752 IH: Congratulating Marcel Closset, a French citizen and former member of the French Resistance who was instrumental in saving a United States Army Air Corps pilot during World War II, for receiving the French Legion of Honor.
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. O’Rourke submitted the following resolution; which was referred to the Committee on Foreign Affairs

form.official-title: Congratulating Marcel Closset, a French citizen and former member of the French Resistance who was instrumental in saving a United States Army Air Corps pilot during World War II, for receiving the French Legion of Honor.

whereas.text: Whereas, on September 27, 2014, Marcel Closset, a French citizen and former member of the French Resistance, received the French Legion of Honor in the rank of Knight;
Whereas the French Legion of Honor is the highest-ranking order and decoration given in France;

Whereas Marcel Closset is the current president of L’Amicale des Anciens du maquis de Mazinghien, an association that works to preserve the memory of the members of the French Resistance who fought for the liberation of Mazinghien, France, in 1944; and

Whereas Marcel Closset was one of four people who risked their lives to rescue and hide Eliot Shapleigh, Sr., a United States Army Air Corps pilot from El Paso, Texas, who was forced to parachute from his crippled P–51 Mustang into Nazi-occupied France in 1944: Now, therefore, be it

section.text: That the House of Representatives congratulates Marcel Closset for receiving the French Legion of Honor.
